title: SCAM Pipe Generator Options Schema

examples.description: Generates a `MyTransformationPipe` in a `my-transformation` folder in the `my-lib` project

description: Creates a new, generic Angular pipe definition in the given or default project.

name.x-prompt: What name would you like to use for the pipe?

directory.description: The directory at which to create the component file. When `--nameAndDirectoryFormat=as-provided`, it will be relative to the current working directory. Otherwise, it will be relative to the workspace root.

nameAndDirectoryFormat.description: Whether to generate the component in the directory as provided, relative to the current working directory and ignoring the project (`as-provided`) or generate it using the project and directory relative to the workspace root (`derived`).

project.x-deprecated: Provide the `directory` option instead and use the `as-provided` format. The project will be determined from the directory provided. It will be removed in Nx v19.

skipTests.description: Do not create `spec.ts` test files for the new pipe.

inlineScam.description: Create the NgModule in the same file as the Pipe.

flat.description: Create the new files at the top level of the current project.
flat.x-deprecated: Provide the `directory` option instead and use the `as-provided` format. It will be removed in Nx v19.

export.description: Specifies if the SCAM should be exported from the project's entry point (normally `index.ts`). It only applies to libraries.
